Assertion (A): The instance variables are also called the data members of a class and are globally available in a Java program. Reason (R): They are declared within the outer wrapper but outside the member methods.
options: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is the correct explanation of Assertion (A).
Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is not the correct explanation of Assertion(A).
Assertion (A) is true but Reason (R) is false.
Assertion (A) is false but Reason (R) is true.
mcqs.correctAnswer: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is the correct explanation of Assertion (A).

mcqs.question: Assertion (A): The new operator is used to create an instance of the class. Reason (R): It allocates space in the dynamic memory for storage of an object at run time.
options: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is the correct explanation of Assertion (A).
Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is not the correct explanation of Assertion(A).

mcqs.correctAnswer: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is the correct explanation of Assertion (A).

mcqs.question: An object is also called.......... of a class.

Which of the following is not true for recursive method?
options: It is invoked in the body of the same method.
It does not return a value.
It uses only a single parameter.
mcqs.correctAnswer: It uses only a single parameter.

mcqs.question: One of the advantages of recursive technique is:
options: It uses only pass by value technique.
The code is clear and precise.
mcqs.correctAnswer: The code is clear and precise.

mcqs.question: The recursive technique is different than iterative technique because:
options: Recursive technique takes more time to execute than iterative technique.
Iterative construct is used for repeating the execution but recursive does not repeat the execution.
The logic creation is complex using iterative process than recursive process.
Recursive technique uses in-built method but not the iterative technique.
mcqs.correctAnswer: Recursive technique takes more time to execute than iterative technique.

mcqs.question: A tail recursion uses recursive case:
options: In the beginning of the recursive method.
At the end of the recursive method.
In between the statements of the recursive method.
As a formal parameter of the recursive method.
mcqs.correctAnswer: At the end of the recursive method.

mcqs.question: Binary recursion is:
options: Called from two points of the same method
mcqs.correctAnswer: Called from two points of the same method

mcqs.question: A function that has two points of call from its block, is called ............ .
Calling a function from the body of the same function is called ............. recursion.
Recursive technique occupies ................ memory space.

Assertion (A): Every recursive function uses a condition to terminate, known as ‘Base Case’. Reason (R): The control terminates the function, if the condition for base case is true, otherwise it keeps calling the function.
options: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is the correct explanation of Assertion (A).
Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is not the correct explanation of Assertion(A).
Assertion (A) is true but Reason (R) is false.
Assertion (A) is false but Reason (R) is true.
mcqs.correctAnswer: Both Assertion (A) and Reason (R) are true and Reason (R) is the correct explanation of Assertion (A).

mcqs.question: What type of data is not accessed in derived class?
A private member method is only accessed:
options: In the scope of the same class in which it is defined.
Anywhere outside the class in which it is defined.
mcqs.correctAnswer: In the scope of the same class in which it is defined.

mcqs.question: .......... is a common field for all the objects of a class.

Which of the following is a combination of more than one inheritance systems?
What is another name of multilevel inheritance?
When inheritance takes place:
options: Derived class acquires features from base class.
A base class acquires features from derived class.
A superclass acquires features from a target.
Base and derived classes mutually share data between them.
mcqs.correctAnswer: Derived class acquires features from base class.

mcqs.question: What does getter do during inheritance?
options: Returns private data to be used in subclass
Returns protected data to be used in subclass
Returns private data to be used in base class
Returns public data to be used in abstract class
mcqs.correctAnswer: Returns private data to be used in subclass

mcqs.question: A superclass constructor is invoked:
options: In a method of base class
In a method of derived class
In nested form of subclass constructor
mcqs.correctAnswer: In nested form of subclass constructor

mcqs.question: What is true for an abstract class?
options: It does not allow creating the objects.
It returns an object to main( ) function.
mcqs.correctAnswer: It does not allow creating the objects.
